text: Rutland is a unitary authority and ceremonial county in England. Until 1 April 1997 it was a non-metropolitan district in Leicestershire. ==Political control== Since the first election to the council in 1973 political control of the council has been held by the following parties: Non-metropolitan district {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Party in control!!Years |- |style="background-color: " | |Independent || 1973-1987 |- |style="background- color: " | |No overall control || 1987-1995 |- |style="background-color: " | |Independent || 1995-1997 |} Unitary authority {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Party in control!!Years |- |style="background-color: " | |Independent || 1996-1998 |- |style="background-color: " | |No overall control || 1998-2003 |- |style="background-color: " | |Conservative || 2003–present |} ==Council elections== ===Non-metropolitan district elections=== *1973 Rutland District Council election *1976 Rutland District Council election *1979 Rutland District Council election (New ward boundaries)legislation.gov.uk - The District of Rutland (Electoral Arrangements) Order 1977. Retrieved on 19 November 2015. *1983 Rutland District Council election *1987 Rutland District Council election *1991 Rutland District Council election (District boundary changes took place but the number of seats remained the same)legislation.gov.uk - The Derbyshire, Leicestershire, Lincolnshire, Nottinghamshire and Warwickshire (County Boundaries) Order 1991. Retrieved on 5 November 2015. *1995 Rutland District Council election ===Unitary authority elections=== *1996 Rutland County Council election *1999 Rutland County Council election *2003 Rutland County Council election (new ward boundaries increased the number of seats from 20 to 26)legislation.gov.uk - The District of Rutland (Electoral Changes) Order 2003. Retrieved on 3 November 2015. *2007 Rutland County Council election *2011 Rutland County Council election *2015 Rutland County Council election *2019 Rutland County Council election (new ward boundaries increased the number of seats to 27) ==By-election results== ===1996–1999=== ===1999–2003=== ===2003–2007=== ===2007–2011=== ==References== ==External links== *Rutland County Council *Rutland election results *By- election results Category:Council elections in the East Midlands Category:Council elections in Rutland Category:Unitary authority elections in England
title: Rutland County Council elections
